etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in Acts of Assembly, Island Jamaica. Either from re- + assay, or directly from reassay

definitions: The action of reassay; an instance of this, a second or subsequent assay.

etymologies: late 16th century (in an earlier sense). From re- + assay

definitions: To retest the purity of (a metal or ore).
To perform a second or subsequent biochemical, physiological, or immunological assay of (a sample) to assess the strength or activity of a biologically active substance.
